result.markdown:
---
title: "Anova fatorial"
---


A Anova fatorial é uma extensão da análise de variância que permite investigar o efeito de dois ou mais fatores categóricos e suas interações em uma variável dependente contínua.


::: {.cell hash='Aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_b68a25465ed3abd18754d502e244da19'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)

li <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=2023059672")
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_5ca8a2404b6d20a57530261b9f2529fa'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
li |>
  ggplot(aes(factor(dose), severity, color = factor(dose)))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1)+
  facet_wrap(~treat)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Modelo fatorial(two-way anova)

Fatorial testa a interação entre os tratamentos.


::: {.cell hash='Aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_6a79ab95c4fb67cda55d1396631dbd4d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mf <- lm(severity ~treat*factor(dose),
         data = li)
mf
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = severity ~ treat * factor(dose), data = li)

Coefficients:
                    (Intercept)                treatTebuconazole  
                         0.2921                          -0.2711  
                  factor(dose)2  treatTebuconazole:factor(dose)2  
                        -0.2420                           0.2412  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(mf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: severity
                   Df   Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
treat               1 0.113232 0.113232  30.358 4.754e-05 ***
factor(dose)        1 0.073683 0.073683  19.755 0.0004077 ***
treat:factor(dose)  1 0.072739 0.072739  19.502 0.0004326 ***
Residuals          16 0.059678 0.003730                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(mf))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)
mf_medias <- emmeans(mf, ~ dose | treat)
mf_medias
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
treat = Ionic liquid:
 dose emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
  0.5 0.2921 0.0273 16  0.23420   0.3500
  2.0 0.0501 0.0273 16 -0.00781   0.1080

treat = Tebuconazole:
 dose emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL
  0.5 0.0210 0.0273 16 -0.03690   0.0789
  2.0 0.0202 0.0273 16 -0.03768   0.0781

Confidence level used: 0.95 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(multcomp)
cld(mf_medias)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
treat = Ionic liquid:
 dose emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
  2.0 0.0501 0.0273 16 -0.00781   0.1080  1    
  0.5 0.2921 0.0273 16  0.23420   0.3500   2   

treat = Tebuconazole:
 dose emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
  2.0 0.0202 0.0273 16 -0.03768   0.0781  1    
  0.5 0.0210 0.0273 16 -0.03690   0.0789  1    

Confidence level used: 0.95 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(mf$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mf$residuals
W = 0.86792, p-value = 0.0108
```
:::
:::


O exemplo mostra se é significativo o efeito da dose no tratamento (estimar as médias de um dentro do outro).
